newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU drops probe into Dun & Bradstreet/IRI data row.
newsitem.headline: EU drops probe into Dun & Bradstreet/IRI data row.

text.p: The European Commission said on Tuesday it had dropped a probe into allegations that AC Nielsen, a subsidiary of Dun & Bradstreet, abused its position in the European market for sales data collection after Nielsen changed its practices.
"Karel Van Miert, the commissioner responsible for competition policy, has obtained an undertaking from AC Nielsen Company to modify its contractual practices," it said in a statement.

The Commission started an investigation in May into a complaint by Information Resources Inc that Nielsen's practices were effectively stopping it from accessing sales data in Europe which is necessary for providing retail tracking services.
Dun & Bradstreet and Information Resources are both from the United States.
